intro: Dimorphanthera hirsutiflora, commonly known as the hairy-flowered dimorphanthera, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy leaves and showy, colorful flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat. Due to its unique appearance and restricted distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
